divs: sighting detailsi saw a neon-rimmed ufo on december 1977 when i was living in charlotte, nc. i was laying in bed one evening in my darkened room. the window curtains were parted and the night sky was clear. around 9pm my eyes caught a glimpse of a lighted object traveling at a distance above the trees of my backyard. it looked strange and i took notice of it. when the object cleared the trees i saw what appeared to be a circular disc about the size of a golf ball. the object's rim was lit with a band of white light similar to a neon light. this light was uniform and steady without any blinking or strobing. in the center of the object was a point of white light. the object glided overhead at a deliberate speed traveling due north. it made no perceivable sound. i carefully watch the object for about 10 seconds until it flew over some nearby woods. excitedly i got dressed and ran outside, but the object wasn't visible because of the tall trees. i had to run about two blocks to a large street before i could get a clear view of the sky. looking north i spotted the object. it had traveled a good distance in the minute it had taken me to get dressed and run to the street. the object now looked like a horizontal white line. its size was slightly larger than the width of the moon and it was receding into the distance. i could see two points of white light -- one above and another below the rim light. (i had seen only the bottom point light previously.) both point lights were centrally placed, the space between them being about 1\4 of the rim's width. i watched the object for another two minutes as it flew off into the far horizon and finally disappeared. the object always maintained a straight flight, its rim never tilting away from horizontal. as the object flew away i compared it with two aircraft that were visible in other areas of the sky. both appeared to be commercial airliners with familiar blinking and colored lights. while i could easily identify these airplanes, the unknown object looked like nothing i'd ever seen. however, despite its strange appearance, the object seemed rather banal and non-threatening. i had a vague feeling that it was built by humans and was being flown for mundane reasons. that was my impression of the craft at the time.
